description.narrative: 2. Professional development of community-based organization and Ministry of Health staff, law enforcement, media personnel and parents – September October 2022 - Completion 100% - Training material on GBV project design and proposal writing, referral systems, and updated Standard Operating Procedures (SOPS) was developed. Completed - Safe referal training of 34 participants from 29 CBOs in Sweileh and Ajloun and 4 Community leaders were counducted by the IFH training departemnt , the training utilized the interactive approach. - SOPs training for 30 IFH SGBV case mangers , Community mobiliser and case manager supervisors , were counducted , the aim of the training was to build the capacity for IFH service providers , and to provide the services under the national accridit standards . - IFH SGBV case mangers provided case mangement services for 160 GBV survivors in addition to continuous provision of psychosocial support during the outbreak if COVIS- 19 pemndmaic through IFH hotlines available 24/7. report Annexed - 378 satisfaction surveys were conducted for the GBV survivors , in the relatives centers , as Pre – assessment surveys , this tool were adapted by SGBV programme with MEAL department , the case manager supervisors filled the surveys taken the confidentiality in the consideration , while M&E specialist conducted the analysis for all data . average level of satisfaction 87%. - IFH developed two phases of satisfaction surveys pre -capacity building for the centers- and post utilizing the Hopkins Symptoms Checklist (HSCL) ; a well-known and widely used screening instrument. it is a symptom inventory which measures symptoms of anxiety and depression. IFH evaluated the current level of anxiety and depression among 400 GBV cases . The Pre and Post Hopkins Test were designed and conducted for the GBV survivors in the targeted centers to measure improvement and psychosocial well-being of the GBV survivors ( depression and anxiety), all the data were analyzed by M&E specialist .the analysis result showed the improvement in the well-being and the psychosocial situation for the survivors. Number of GBV cases who were pre-assessed using Hopkins test was 212, of which 57% were post assessed for 3-month point, and 4% for 6-month point, as follows - Karak: 110 pre-assessed, 54 post-assessed after 3 months (of which 4 cases showed deterioration) - Sweileh: 38 pre-assessed, 22 post-assessed after 3 months. - Zarqa: 64 pre-assessed, 45 post-assessed after 3 months (of which 5 cases showed deterioration), and 8 post-assessed after 6 months.

title.narrative: Pre and Post Hopkins Test for the GBV survivors to measure improvement and psychosocial well being of the GBV survivors

description.narrative: - IFH developed a two phases of satisfaction surveys pre -capacity building for the centres- and post utilizing the Hopkins Symptoms Checklist (HSCL) ; a well-known and widely used screening instrument. it is a symptom inventory which measures symptoms of anxiety and depression. IFH evaluated the current level of anxiety and depression among 400 GBV cases . The Pre and Post Hopkins Test were designed and conducted for the GBV survivors in the targeted centers to measure improvement and psychosocial well being of the GBV survivors ( depression and anxiety), all the data were analyzed by M&E specialist .the analysis result showed the improvement in the well being and the psychosocial situation for the survivors.

title.narrative: Pre and Post Hopkins Test for the GBV survivors to measure improvement and psychosocial well being of the GBV survivors

Pre and Post Hopkins Test for the GBV survivors to measure improvement and psychosocial well being of the GBV survivors
Number of GBV cases who were pre-assessed using Hopkins test was 212, of which 57% were post assessed for 3-month point, and 4% for 6-month point, as follows -Karak: 110 pre-assessed, 54 post-assessed after 3 months (of which 4 cases showed deterioration) -Sweileh: 38 pre-assessed, 22 post-assessed after 3 months. -Zarqa: 64 pre-assessed, 45 post-assessed after 3 months (of which 5 cases showed deterioration), and 8 post-assessed after 6 months. -Ajloun – 24 pre -assessed , 24 post assessed after 3 months

description.narrative: 378 satisfaction surveys were conducted for the GBV survivors , in the relatives centers , as Pre – assessment surveys , this tool were adapted by SGBV programme with MEAL department , the case manger supervisors filled the surveys taken the confidentiality in consideration , while M&E specialist conducted the analysis for all data. Average level of satisfaction 87%

title.narrative: Case management services for the GBV during the outbreak of COVIS- 19 pandemic through IFH hotlines available 24/7 .

description.narrative: IFH SGBV case mangers provided case management services for the GBV survivors in addition to continuous provision of psychosocial support during the outbreak of COVIS- 19 pandemic through IFH hotlines available 24/7 .
